Comment: Panel interview. They were all friendly and helpful. The interview was smooth and easy. Most questions were about myself customer service. No scenarios. Just be you. The interview did not take long.

writing a job description posting a job scheduling interviews conducting preliminary interviews conducting inperson interviews following up with candidates and making a hire. Introductions. Small Talk. Information Gathering. Question/Answer. Wrapping Up.

I applied online. I was contacted by HR for interview several months later. They also requested referees whom they contacted for references. The interview was then also held online with a panel of around 6 people. HR then took over six months to give feedback after the interview and ignored emails requesting updates.
The process was average they wanted to get to know me better and understand why I wanted the post. It was important for them to know why I was passionate about making a career in academia
It was scary but it taught me how to approach interview questions first interview ever give it your best shot Be very prepared test yourself ask yourself question  and you'll be all good
Quick and straight forward. They asked me questions that allowed them to see what I can bring to the company. The interview process took roughly 30 minutes. It was a really good interview

Zoom interview due to Covid restrictions. The interviewer was very bubbly and made me feel at ease. The interview was more of a informal discussion about what i could bring to the table and my career aspirations.
The process was fairly easy and straight forward. They basically just wanted to know about your background and what value you'll bring to the team.  You'll need to provide your academic record.

Both panel and practicals Panel asked about previous work experience and values will be adding to the organisation. Ideally the plan was to share my international experience in the food industry which was a good balance to my qulaifications.
I applied online and I was called few weeks after that I have been shortlisted.the interview went smooth and it was a conversation and an interesting experience that I will choose to do over again

Pleasant and brief I was alerted via email of the interview which took about 30minutes. The questions were pretty standard and easy to answer. The management within the department were clearly looking for wellbalanced candidates.

It was as proffesional as much as i expected it to be. The panel consisted of more than ten members which is a bit scary for a person who might be a first timer on an interview. The panel was impressed about my appearance and how honest i was with my previous experiences outside the university and inside. My confidents also played an important role as the panel continued with their questions.
